title: Rebuild and deploy existing TradeBuddy app

requirements.text: Verify the Welcome screen is correctly set as the initial screen when the app loads, ensuring it appears before the Home Dashboard and that the Continue button successfully navigates to the Home Dashboard.
acceptanceCriteria: When the app loads, the Welcome screen is displayed first
The Continue button on the Welcome screen navigates to the Home Dashboard
Bottom navigation is hidden on the Welcome screen
Bottom navigation appears on all other main screens (Home, Learn, Trade, Practice, Alerts, Live, Profile)

requirements.text: Ensure all existing screens (Home Dashboard, Learning, Trading, Demo Trading, Alerts, Live Chart Practice, Profile/Settings) are functioning correctly with their mock data and interactive features.
acceptanceCriteria: Home Dashboard displays market overview, trending stocks, indices, and watchlist
Learning screen shows categorized lessons and video tutorials
Trading screen renders stock selector, chart, and indicators
Demo Trading page manages virtual positions and trade history
Alerts screen allows creating, toggling, and deleting price alerts
Live Chart Practice simulates price movement with playback controls
Profile/Settings screen allows theme toggle and risk level selection

requirements.text: Verify that the app theme (light/dark mode) is working correctly with the blue/green/white color palette and consistent styling across all screens.
acceptanceCriteria: Light mode uses the defined blue/green/white palette
Dark mode applies appropriate color adjustments
Theme toggle in Profile/Settings persists across sessions
All screens respect the selected theme consistently

constraints: Do not modify the backend/main.mo file as it is intentionally empty
Preserve all existing mock data and state management logic
Keep immutable frontend paths unchanged (useInternetIdentity, useActor, main.tsx, ui components)
nonGoals: Adding real market data or external API integrations
Implementing actual trading functionality or real money transactions
Adding new screens or features beyond what already exists
Modifying the technology stack or framework choices
